titleStmt.title: Treason pretended against the King of Scots by certaine lordes and gentlemen, whose names hereafter followe. With a declaration of the Kinges Maiesties intention to his last acts of Parliament: which openeth fully in effect of all the saide conspiracy. Out of Skottish into English.
titleStmt.author: Studley, Christopher.
James I, King of England, 1566-1625.
Adamson, Patrick, 1537-1592. Declaration of the Kings Majesties intentioun and meaning toward the lait actis of Parliament. aut

publicationStmt.publisher: For Thomas Nelson, and are to be solde at the West ende of Paules,

notesStmt.note: "The Kings Maiesties intention" (an Anglicized version of: Adamson, Patrick. A declaration of the Kings Majesties intentioun and meaning toward the lait actis of Parliament) has caption title.
Identified as STC 23402 on UMI microfilm reel 582.
Reproduction of the original in the Folger Shakespeare Library.
